# SCNDebugOptions

**Structure**

Options for drawing overlays with SceneKit content that can aid in debugging, used with the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNSceneRenderer/debugOptions] property.

## Declaration

```swift
struct SCNDebugOptions
```

## Overview

Debug options are bit mask patterns. To display multiple debugging overlays, combine options using the bitwise OR operator.

## Debugging Geometry and Animation

- **showBoundingBoxes**: Display the bounding boxes for any nodes with content.
- **showWireframe**: Display geometries in the scene with wireframe rendering.
- **renderAsWireframe**: Display only wireframe placeholders for geometries in the scene.
- **showSkeletons**: Display visualizations of the skeletal animation parameters for relevant geometries.
- **showCreases**: Display nonsmoothed crease regions for geometries affected by surface subdivision.
- **showConstraints**: Display visualizations of the constraint objects acting on nodes in the scene.

## Debugging Cameras and Lighting

- **showCameras**: Display visualizations for nodes in the scene with attached cameras and their fields of view.
- **showLightInfluences**: Display the locations of each [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNLight] object in the scene.
- **showLightExtents**: Display the regions affected by each [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNLight] object in the scene.

## Debugging Physics

- **showPhysicsShapes**: Display the physics shapes for any nodes with attached [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNPhysicsBody] objects.
- **showPhysicsFields**: Display the regions affected by each [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNPhysicsField] object in the scene.

## Initializers

- **init(rawValue:)**

## Type Properties

- **showFeaturePoints**: Display a point cloud showing intermediate results of the scene analysis that ARKit uses to track device position.
- **showWorldOrigin**: Display a coordinate axis visualization indicating the position and orientation of the AR world coordinate system.

## Managing Scene Display

- **pointOfView**: The node from which the scene’s contents are viewed for rendering.
- **autoenablesDefaultLighting**: A Boolean value that determines whether SceneKit automatically adds lights to a scene.
- **isJitteringEnabled**: A Boolean value that determines whether SceneKit applies jittering to reduce aliasing artifacts.
- **showsStatistics**: A Boolean value that determines whether SceneKit displays rendering performance statistics in an accessory view.
- **debugOptions**: Options for drawing overlay content in a scene that can aid debugging.
- **renderingAPI**: The graphics technology SceneKit uses to render the scene.
- **SCNRenderingAPI**: Options for choosing the graphics technology for an [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNView] object (or other SceneKit renderer) to use for drawing its contents. Used by the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNSceneRenderer/renderingAPI] property and the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNView/Option/preferredRenderingAPI] option when initializing an [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNView] object.

## Conforms To

- BitwiseCopyable
- Equatable
- ExpressibleByArrayLiteral
- OptionSet
- RawRepresentable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
- SetAlgebra
